title: How to Grill Opah

methods.name: Making Simple Grilled Opah with Asparagus

steps.headline: Heat a gas or charcoal grill.
steps.description: Turn a gas grill to high or fill a chimney and light the charcoal. Dump the hot, ashy briquettes in the center of the grill grate. Rub a little vegetable or canola oil on the grate to prevent the fish from sticking.

steps.headline: Season the opah with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
steps.description: Set 2 opah fillets (⁄4 pound (340 g) total) on a plate and season the fish on both sides with 1/2 teaspoon (2.5 ml) of olive oil. Sprinkle both sides of the fish with salt and pepper to taste.

steps.headline: Toss the asparagus with olive oil, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
steps.description: Put 1 pound (450 g) of trimmed asparagus in a long dish. Drizzle it with the remaining 2 teaspoons (10 ml) of olive oil and sprinkle the asparagus with 1/8 teaspoon (0.25 g) of garlic powder, and salt and pepper to taste. Use a spoon or your fingers to mix the asparagus so it's evenly coated.

steps.headline: Grill the seasoned asparagus for 4 to 5 minutes.
steps.description: Lay the seasoned asparagus across the grill grate so the pieces don't fall through the grate. You could also lay the asparagus in a grilling basket that's set directly on the grill. Grill the asparagus for 4 to 5 minutes, so it softens and blackens a little. Grilling baskets are metal containers that are square or circular. They have holes and handles, so you can fill them with food and set them directly onto the grill grate. Buy grilling baskets at the hardware or grocery store.

steps.headline: Grill the opah with asparagus for 2 to 3 minutes.
steps.description: Use tongs to flip the asparagus over and lay the seasoned opah on the grill. Cook the asparagus for 2 to 3 minutes.

steps.headline: Flip and grill the opah and asparagus for 2 to 3 more minutes.
steps.description: Use the tongs to flip the fish and let it cook on the other side for 2 to 3 minutes. Both sides of the fish should be cooked while the inside will be medium-rare. If you prefer your fish to be medium, grill the opah for another 2 minutes. Check for doneness by scraping a fork against the center of the fish. The fish will become dry and flaky in the center.

steps.headline: Remove the grilled opah and asparagus and serve.
steps.description: Once the opah is as cooked as you like, transfer it to a serving plate. Remove the asparagus and place it on the serving plate with the fish. Serve the fish with freshly squeezed lemon juice and steamed rice. Store the leftover fish in an airtight container for 3 to 4 days.

steps.headline: Light a charcoal grill or turn a gas grill to high.
steps.description: To heat the charcoal grill, fill a chimney with briquettes and light them. Dump the hot, ashy briquettes in the center of the grill grate and lightly oil the grate. This will prevent the fish from sticking to it.

steps.headline: Season the opah with canola oil, salt, and lemon pepper seasoning.
steps.description: Use your fingers or a pastry brush to coat 1 pound (450 g) of opah steaks with 1 to 2 tablespoons (15 to 30 mL) of canola oil. Sprinkle each side of the fish steaks with Hawaiian black lava sea salt and lemon pepper seasoning to taste.

steps.headline: Grill the opah for 4 to 5 minutes.
steps.description: Lay the seasoned fish steaks on the greased grill grate. Cook the opah for 4 to 5 minutes, so the bottom browns a little.

steps.headline: Flip and grill the opah for 4 to 5 more minutes.
steps.description: Use tongs to flip each opah steak over. Cook the opah until the outsides are cooked and the centers are medium. The fish will flake if you scrape the center with a fork. If you want the fish medium-well, grill it for 2 to 3 more minutes. For medium-rare, reduce the cooking time by 2 minutes.

steps.headline: Remove and serve the grilled opah.
steps.description: Transfer the opah to a serving plate and use a fork or your fingers to break the steaks into chunks. To serve the opah in tacos, set out tortillas, cabbage slaw, corn relish, and salsa fresca. Let your guests assemble their own opah tacos. Refrigerate the leftover opah in an airtight container for 3 to 4 days.

methods.name: Making Blackened Opah on the Grill

steps.headline: Combine the blackening seasoning in a small bowl.
steps.description: Mix together 2 teaspoons (11 g) of sea salt, 1 teaspoon (2 g) of fresh cracked pepper, 1 1/2 teaspoons (3 g) of paprika, 1 tablespoon (6 g) of dried thyme, and 1 teaspoon (2 g) of cayenne.

steps.headline: Brush the opah with butter or oil and rub the blackening seasoning over it.
steps.description: Lay 1 to 2 pieces of opah on a plate and brush 1 to 2 tablespoons (15 to 30 mL) of melted butter or olive oil over the fish. Spread the blackening seasoning evenly over the fish. Use your fingers to rub the seasoning into the fish and set it aside while you heat the grill.

steps.headline: Heat a gas or charcoal grill.
steps.description: Turn a gas grill to high or heat a full chimney of briquettes. Once the briquettes are hot and lightly covered in ash, dump them in the center of the grill grate. Brush a little canola or vegetable oil on the grate to prevent the fish from sticking to it.

steps.headline: Grill the opah for 5 minutes.
steps.description: Lay the seasoned opah on the grill so it's directly over the briquettes or the hottest part of the grill. Cook the opah for 5 minutes so it blackens on the bottom.

steps.headline: Flip and grill the opah for 3 to 5 more minutes.
steps.description: Use tongs to flip the fish over and grill it until it's cooked on the outside. The opah will be medium-rare after 3 to 5 minutes, but you could cook it 2 to 3 more minutes, if you prefer your fish well-done. If the fish is medium-rare, it will be soft and tender. Well-done fish will be completely dry, firm, and flaky.

steps.headline: Serve the blackened opah.
steps.description: Remove the opah from the grill and serve it immediately. Blackened opah goes well with steamed rice, cabbage, or roasted vegetables. Refrigerate leftover blackened opah in an airtight container for 3 to 4 days.
